message: Bob, I'm offering you my product for $12,000. It's a great deal, and I'm sure you'll find it very valuable. Let me know what you think!
Thank you for your offer, Alice. I appreciate the value of your product, but I am only able to pay up to $10,000 for it. Would you be willing to consider this lower price?

Bob, I appreciate your offer and your interest in my product. While I understand your budget constraints, $10,000 is significantly below my minimum acceptable price. I'm willing to come down to $11,500. This is a fair price that reflects the value of the product and gives you a good deal. Let's see if we can find common ground.
Alice, thank you for adjusting your price. However, I'm still unable to meet you at $11,500. I would like to propose $10,500 as a counteroffer. I hope this brings us closer to reaching an agreement.

Bob, I appreciate your persistence in finding a price we can both agree on. However, $10,500 is still significantly below my minimum acceptable price. I'm willing to go down to $11,000. This is my final offer, and it represents a compromise on my part. If this isn't acceptable, I will be moving forward with another buyer.
